style.name: American-Style Amber/Red Ale
style.description: American amber/red ales range from light copper to light brown in color. They are characterized by American-variety hops used to produce the perception of medium hop bitterness, flavor, and medium aroma. Amber ales have medium-high to high maltiness with medium to low caramel character. They should have medium to medium-high body. The style may have low levels of fruityester flavor and aroma. Diacetyl can be either absent or barely perceived at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. Slight yeast haze is acceptable for bottle-conditioned products.

breweries.name: Detroit Beer Company
breweries.description:
Opened in September 2003, the Detroit Beer Co. occupies the first two floors of the recently restored Hartz Building on Broadway in Downtown Detroit just steps from Comerica Park and Ford field making it the best spot for pre & post event. The historic setting, combined with state-of-the-art brewing technology and 21st century finishes provides a unique dining experience. Seating is available on both floors and can be reserved for special events.



The menu features a broad selection of eclectic American cuisine, all prepared with the freshest ingredients. From delectable appetizers, fresh salads, pizzas and pastas to delicious entrees and unique sandwiches, the menu has something for everyone and a kids menu is available

style.name: American-Style Amber/Red Ale

Diacetyl can be either absent or barely perceived at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. Slight yeast haze is acceptable for bottle-conditioned products.

breweries.name: Odd Side Ales
breweries.description: ​Welcome to Odd Side Ales, one of the fastest growing breweries in Michigan. Born in an old piano factory in downtown Grand Haven, Michigan, Odd Side Ales first opened its doors in March 2010. We've grown steadily since that first brew, but have never lost sight of our initial goal: to create a variety of complex beers, each with its own unique flavor. To that end, we strive to craft unusual beers that will make your taste buds dance. Whether you're looking for the perfect IPA or something ... just a little different, we've got the beer for you.

data.name: Grandma's Cookies
data.description: A product of another collaboration, this time with our friends at Mittenbrew. The inspiration for this recipe comes from the flavor profile of oatmeal raisin cookies. Dark caramel malts add the similar flavor of dried fruit, like raisins. Brown sugar, a touch of cinnamon and a heap of rolled oats are the ingredients of focus for this sweet n’ creamy amber ale.

breweries.name: Rockford Brewing Company
breweries.description: RBC produces world class beers using traditional and innovative brewing techniques and ingredients. As a company, we strive to create unique beers with influences from countries around the world including the United States, Belgium, Germany, the United Kingdom, and the newest emerging craft beer location that has the world watching; Michigan. Part of our niche is working closely with West Michigan farmers and local ingredients on a seasonal basis. We love to incorporate West Michigan agricultural products into our offerings!

data.name: Grateful Red
data.description: While the fiery red hue may deceive you of its inherent hoppiness, the play of toasty malt flavors with sharp, resiny hops will bring you to the strangest of places, if you’re drinking it right.

breweries.name: Capital Brewery
breweries.description:
Located in a former egg processing plant building, Capital Brewery produced its first brew at 6:30 pm, April 17, 1986.

The brewhouse features two copper brewing kettles. These units, now over 50 years old, were originally used at the former Hoxter Brewery located in Germany.

At the heart of the operation is a group of loyal and hard working employees dedicated to producing the high quality beer that Capital Brewery is known for.

Most of the beers brewed here at Capital consist of traditional ingredients, water, malted barley and wheat, hops and yeast. However, we do believe in experimentation to develop unique beer styles and varieties. We invite you to enjoy one of our beers in our brewery or take some home for a true Capital experience.


Capital Brewery was established with an important mission in mind, and we continually build on that sentiment, by delivering a unique experience and award winning beers to meet the changing demands of the craft beer community.

breweries.name: McKenzie Brewing Company
breweries.description:
All of our beers are brewed in very small batches so they are always fresh and at their peak. Our brewers consistently bring home awards from the Great American Beer Festival, 24 medals so far. Our award-winning beers are brewed at all three locations, where our brewers strive to push the creative envelope.  Our beer selection is both consistent, with four flagship brands, and fresh with new offerings of seasonal and dark beers.

Unfortunately we can not go under the Steelhead name due to Trademark issues so we will be McKenzie Brewing Company.

data.name: Great Raft Amber
data.description: A true amber that is dark red in appearance with subtle roasty and chocolate aromas. Chocolate and toffee flavors dominate, while the fruity English hops balance the strong malt character.

breweries.name: Great Raft Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Great Raft Brewing is a Shreveport, Louisiana based craft brewery dedicated to making creative, authentic beer and helping to build a great beer culture within communities it serves. Co-founders Andrew and Lindsay Nations are Shreveport natives with a passion for beer. Born from their desire to bring exciting, flavorful, fresh craft beer to their hometown, Great Raft Brewing is bringing the craft brewing tradition to Northern Louisiana. 

Great Raft Brewing was founded on the principle of brewing what we call “Real Beer.” Real Beer is brewed with creativity, passion, and authenticity. Our beer is brewed with creativity that pushes the boundaries of style, a passion for greatness, and authentic, quality ingredients. Drink Real Beer. You deserve it.

style.name: American-Style Amber/Red Ale
style.description: American amber/red ales range from light copper to light brown in color. They are characterized by American-variety hops used to produce the perception of medium hop bitterness, flavor, and medium aroma. Amber ales have medium-high to high maltiness with medium to low caramel character. They should have medium to medium-high body. The style may have low levels of fruityester flavor and aroma. Diacetyl can be either absent or barely perceived at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. Slight yeast haze is acceptable for bottle-conditioned products.

breweries.name: Green Flash Brewing Company
breweries.description:
A small company with big ideas.

Mike and Lisa Hinkley took their interest in the craft beer industry to a new level in 2002 when they founded Green Flash Brewing Company. Former pub owners, Mike and Lisa jumped into brewing, and in 2004 renowned brewmaster Chuck Silva joined the team.

With Chuck on board we began brewing premium style beers, modern twists on traditional styles, and our beers began to develop a following. Cutting edge brews, Green Flash Brewing Company’s beers don’t fit traditional guidelines, instead we let our hybrid, benchmark beers blaze their own trail.

Located in San Diego, CA, we specialize in brewing assertive and distinctive beers, such as our West Coast I.P.A.: an award-winning beer whose wide acceptance has helped define a category. We also brew seasonal, collaborative and barrel-aged beers.

Our award-winning beers are on draft and bottled and are available throughout the United States in bars, restaurants and retail outlets.

data.name: Green Lakes Amber Ale (Organic)
data.description:
Environmental pedigree aside, Green Lakes Organic Ale is a finely balanced beer with a mellow malt profile and  subtle hop leading edge. On the  ingredient roster: five types of 100% organic malted barleys and a  complementary dose of Liberty and Sterling hops. It’s a profoundly satisfying, easy-drinking beer.

What’s more, no mere enviro wink and nod, Green Lakes Organic Ale is a true ode to Mother Earth. Both product and process have been carefully considered.  Deschutes’s brewhouses are organically  certified by Oregon Tilth. And while all malts are organic, the hops story is a less told eco-tale. A full 80% Salmon-Safe, they’re grown so that surrounding streams are shaded, cool and run-off free, allowing migrating salmon to flourish.

Enjoy in good taste, and conscience.

Read more about Green Lakes Organic Ale being the first beer brewed with Salmon-Safe certified hops.

style.name: American-Style Amber/Red Ale

They are characterized by American-variety hops used to produce the perception of medium hop bitterness, flavor, and medium aroma. Amber ales have medium-high to high maltiness with medium to low caramel character. They should have medium to medium-high body. The style may have low levels of fruityester flavor and aroma. Diacetyl can be either absent or barely perceived at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. Slight yeast haze is acceptable for bottle-conditioned products.

breweries.name: Deschutes Brewery
breweries.description: Founded in 1988, Deschutes Brewery began as a brew pub in downtown Bend, Oregon and is known for such brands as Black Butte Porter, the nation’s number one selling craft porter, and the popular Mirror Pond Pale Ale. In addition to its original Bend pub, this family and employee-owned brewery opened a second pub in Portland’s Pearl District in 2008. The company’s main brewing facility is located on the banks of the Deschutes River and is the nation's 7th largest craft brewery, distributing in 28 states, Washington D.C., and two Canadian provinces. Deschutes Brewery was named one of America’s Best Places to Work in 2013 & 2014 by Outside Magazine.

data.name: Green Man Ale
data.description: Inspired by the malty and hoppy beers of the Great Northwest, Green Man Ale is a rich and layered beer that lies somewhere between an IPA and a Red Ale—not exactly radical, but not quite the conformist, Green Man Ale just is.

breweries.name: Jack's Brewing
breweries.description:
Founded in 1999, Jack's Brewing Company opened its first full service microbrewery and restaurant at 39176 Argonaut Way, Fremont, California, on the west side of the Fremont Hub shopping center. Jack's is proud to announce the opening of our second location at 2410 San Ramon Valley Blvd., San Ramon, California in August 2009.

Jack's Brewing Company brews on premise every week to allow serving the finest and freshest quality beers in the area. We are known for fantastic California Pub Cuisine, ranging from incredible 1/2 pound gourmet burgers, Certified Angus steak platters, fresh salmon fillets sliced from fresh whole fish to delicious entrée salads and delightful desserts.

A sports themed restaurant with over 20 HD TV's and one 10-foot monster screen, Jack's offers the best sports viewing around at both locations. Our Fremont location offers a banquet facility available to suit corporate or large party needs; San Ramon can accommodate large parties within their dining room. Both locations are pleased to accept reservations for parties of six or greater.

Visit Jack's Brewing Company and enjoy Great Beer, Great Food, and Great Fun!

breweries.name: Bricktown Brewery (OKC)
breweries.description:
Bricktown Brewery opened in October 1992, making history, quality beers, and great food. This started what has become the most unique setting and entertainment establishment in Oklahoma City!

In keeping with the Brewery’s standard of providing our patrons with an exceptional experience, we have transformed the historical turn-of-the century building into a great place to find award winning beers, great food, and plenty of fun for all ages!

data.name: Grinnin' Grizzly Spiced Ale
data.description: This amber ale is dosed with cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger, and fresh orange zest. It is well balanced with low hop flavor and nice hint of the spices in the finish. This spiced ale is not overbearing; rather it is smooth and very drinkable.

data.name: Grizzly Bear
data.description:
Brewed with Organic Floor Malted Pale Malt, Munich, Special B and de-husked black malt. Hopped with Magnum, Centennial and Chinook in the kettle, dry-hopped with Cascade.

A hoppy American "Red" Ale with all local finishing hops from Hopmeister Farms.

breweries.name: ThirstyBear Brewing Company
breweries.description: ThirstyBear Brewing Co. is San Francisco's only certified organic brewery.  ThirstyBear hand-crafts beers of every description: ales, lagers, barrel-aged, Belgian-inspired, cask conditioned, wet-hopped, dry-hopped - all inspired by tradition and modern creativity. Our brewery crafts only organic beers, ensuring that the beers you consume are good to you and good for our earth.  Our restaurant pairs its beers with Spanish inspired tapas and paellas sourced from the plethora of local and often organic farms that grace our region.  As the only San Francisco certified green brewery-restaurant, we promote the business of sustainability. Founded on September 13, 1996, ThirstyBear is now the oldest brewery-restaurant in San Francisco.

data.name: Guava India Red Ale
data.description: The final of our four anniversary beers was created by Keith, Will, Tom, Brandon, and Cameron. They've made a hoppy red ale accentuated with the tropical notes of guava fruit.

They jumped in head first and committed their minimal financial resources and made it happen.

breweries.name: Paw Paw Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Paw Paw Brewing Company set out to bring the best brew to the area possible using the best ingredients. Putting people and community above all others Paw Paw Brewing Company will strive to integrate culture and local products while developing hand crafted brews. 

Paw Paw Brewing Company was established in January 2010 by brother-in-laws Ben Fleckenstein and Ryan Sylvester.

breweries.name: Strangeways Brewing
breweries.description: Strangeways Brewing is a one-of-a-kind, 8,400 square-foot production brewery that is open to the public daily.  It houses multiple tasting room spaces along with outdoor seating, and always has 25+ unique beers on tap.  RateBeer named Strangeways “Best Brewery Tap Room in Virginia” in 2014/2015.  Outfitted with a 20 barrel brewhouse, this is where we unhinge the status quo, break through the boring, and invite the unknown.  Make Strangeways Brewing one of your adventure destinations for regular tastings, tours, event/private party bookings, and whatever strange events we come up with.

breweries.name: Crossroads Brewing Company
breweries.description:
If you could be doing whatever you want right now, what would you be doing? For Ken Landin and Janine Bennett the answer to that question would always be "listening to live music and drinking craft beer." Fueled by their outrage over the political and corporate disaster that unfolded on the nightly news, and frustrated by the thought that their lifestyle may contribute to the problem, they were at a crossroads. And so began the plan for Crossroads Brewing Company.
 
There was many years of discussion, research, paperwork, rejection, and searching for the perfect property.  After having deals fall through and the economy taking a turn for the worse, their hopes were fading. Then, in December of 2008, the Brooks Opera House in Historic Athens was discovered by accident. After leaving a restaurant just 2 miles from home they noticed a for sale sign on the deteriorating building and it's just like the old saying goes............when you know, you know.
 
It was quickly realized that when a community believes in what you are doing and puts it's support behind you, great things can happen. So they were off and running from the first turn of the key. Restoring a Historic Opera House from 1893 was not part of the original plan but with hard work and their secret weapon, Janine's brother Jimmy, things are coming together. Ken, Janine, Jimmy and Janine's Dad, Jim, have had their hands on just about every square inch of this 15,000 square foot building. Little by little, this grand and unique property will be restored to it's former glory.
  
Everyday seems to bring a new challenge but the ultimate goal remains clear. This building was once the hub of this sleepy riverside village and Ken and Janine intend to return it to the community. The second floor, where the Opera House once was, will get a new stage for plays and musical performances of all kinds. Athens is surrounded by hard working farmers so looking any further for meats and produce just doesn't make sense.  From organic menu items to earth friendly building materials the environment is a factor in every decision that is made along the way. They hope to eventually have the brewery running "off the grid" as well.
 
Ken, Janine, Brewer Hutch Kugeman and Chef Paul Parillo invite you to come visit the pub in Athens, NY.  There's 10 craft beers on tap and a menu that showcases the small farms of the Hudson Valley.   Cheers!

data.name: Gypsy Tears Ruby Ale
data.description:
Give me your tears, Gypsy! This ruby red ale will mesmerize you with a caravan of malt flavour and entrancing hop presence.

A ruby red coloured ale with a rich caramel malt flavour and a burst of West Coast hop aroma. Using only late hop additions and dry-hopping, the bitterness is restrained while the hop flavour and aroma are large.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: American-Style Amber/Red Ale
style.description: American amber/red ales range from light copper to light brown in color. They are characterized by American-variety hops used to produce the perception of medium hop bitterness, flavor, and medium aroma. Amber ales have medium-high to high maltiness with medium to low caramel character. They should have medium to medium-high body. The style may have low levels of fruityester flavor and aroma. Diacetyl can be either absent or barely perceived at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. Slight yeast haze is acceptable for bottle-conditioned products.

breweries.name: Parallel 49 Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Parallel 49's three founders grew up together in East Vancouver, less than 10 minutes from the spot where the brewery now stands.  Mike, Nick, and Anthony had been avid home brewers and craft beer enthusiasts for years before they finally decided to turn their shared passion into a full time gig.

In 2008, the three friends quit their day jobs and opened a restaurant that quickly became known as a mecca for craft beer enthusiasts in Vancouver.  As the restaurant business thrived, the guys turned their attentions back to the enduring dream of opening their own brewery.

The guys decided that it was time to stop talking and start brewing.  They teamed up with Graham With, a respected home brewer; and Michael Tod, a friend with a wealth of sales experience in the BC craft beer industry.  The newly assembled Parallel 49 team set out to create the unique brand of Vancouver craft beer that they had been thirsting after for years.

data.name: Habanero Amber

breweries.name: Bad Jimmy's Brewery
breweries.description: In todays world to have great taste in beer you have to go to your craft brewers were beer is actually studied and time is taken to insure the quality and taste is always the same. Supporting your local breweries is a great way to keep wonderful, full flavor ale's and lagers available. Ballard, Wa. will soon be the home to Bad Jimmy's with a tap room for everyone to enjoy the full flavor ale's that we have to offer. Watch for us in your local bars and please let us know what you think of our tasty liquid joy.

breweries.name: Crabtree Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Crabtree Brewing Company is dedicated to serving the environment, the community, our customers, and our valued employees.  Requiring the best ingredients to support unique premium beers.  Keeping a dynamic business mind while remaining modestly profitable.   Employing technology, embracing ethics, growing to meet the needs of our customers and employees, and having fun doing what we love - Making Great Beer.

The Crabtree Brewing Company, ltd. is a Colorado based company providing premium ale, wheat, stout, and lager style beers. Established in 2006, this is the first micro-brewery located within Greeley, Colorado.

data.name: Hacker’s Harvest
data.description: This special beer is an ale brewed with apples from the Hacker family orchard. Come hang out with Calfkiller and the Hacker family as we celebrate the life of James Hacker by enjoying this wonderful appley, caramely treat.

breweries.name: Redchurch Brewery
breweries.description: The Redchurch Brewery strives to create uncompromising modern beers. Our beers are distinctive and adventurous, bottle conditioned to allow them time to mature and grow. We never filter or pasteurise so that the depth of flavour and complexity we work hard to produce is preserved. We don’t tolerate bland flavorless beer and neither should you. We hope you enjoy redchurch beer as much as we do.

data.name: Halo Red Amber Ale
data.description: Deep copper-red beer with a creamy collar of foam, and a rich roasty coffee-toffee finish.

breweries.name: McKenzie Brewing Company
breweries.description:
All of our beers are brewed in very small batches so they are always fresh and at their peak. Our brewers consistently bring home awards from the Great American Beer Festival, 24 medals so far. Our award-winning beers are brewed at all three locations, where our brewers strive to push the creative envelope.  Our beer selection is both consistent, with four flagship brands, and fresh with new offerings of seasonal and dark beers.

Unfortunately we can not go under the Steelhead name due to Trademark issues so we will be McKenzie Brewing Company.

breweries.name: Ruddy Duck Brewery and Grill
breweries.description:
Our philosophy is simple:
Create a fun and exciting atmosphere
Serve authentic made from scratch food
Provide gracious and hospitable service
Deliver it all at a great value

To guarantee excellence we buy the highest quality ingredients and prepare them to bring out the best flavors in every dish. Our chicken wings are cooked fresh daily to ensure our signature taste. Fresh and never frozen chicken breast, pork, mahi and salmon are delivered daily.

We buy only grass fed "all natural" steaks and hamburgers to ensure the highest quality. We support local farmers by purchasing our seafood and produce locally whenever available. Our desserts, pizza dough, and house specialty "Chipas" are made daily from scratch as are all our sauces, dressings and soups.

We promote friendly, unobtrusive service delivered with a smile. Most important to us is you, our guests. We strive to be a neighborhood restaurant where families with children, professionals on business, or couples out on a date can all feel welcome and comfortable.

data.name: Hammerhead Red Ale
data.description: Brewed in the style of an American Amber ale, this beer is smooth and complex with a distinctive hop aroma and flavor. Its reddish hue is a result of our brewmaster’s unique combination of crystal malts and chocolate malt used during the mashing process.

data.name: Hammerin' Ale
data.description: HammerinÃ¢â?¬â?¢ Ale is the BarbarianÃ¢â?¬â?¢s first beer. Brewed to be a well-balanced, easy-going beer, HammerinÃ¢â?¬â?¢ Ale comes from a rather simple recipe which yields a deep amber color and a sublime balance of malt character and hop flavors. This beer goes very well with grilled meats and is meant to be enjoyed year-round. HammerinÃ¢â?¬â?¢ Ale is an excellent choice for Ã¢â?¬Å?BarbariansÃ¢â?¬Â who are new to craft beer.

style.name: American-Style Amber/Red Ale
style.description: American amber/red ales range from light copper to light brown in color. They are characterized by American-variety hops used to produce the perception of medium hop bitterness, flavor, and medium aroma. Amber ales have medium-high to high maltiness with medium to low caramel character. They should have medium to medium-high body. The style may have low levels of fruityester flavor and aroma. Diacetyl can be either absent or barely perceived at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. Slight yeast haze is acceptable for bottle-conditioned products.

breweries.name: Bavarian Barbarian Brewing Company
breweries.description: Bavarian Barbarian Brewing Company is Williamsport's first production brewery since the 1950's. The brewery, which occupies 9,000 square feet at 429 W. 3rd St in Williamsport, Pennsylvania, was founded by Mike Hiller in July 2007.  Though a native of South Williamsport, Barbarian Chief, Mike Hiller, first entered the craft brewing industry in 1997 as an Account Services Associate for Legendary Distributors, Ltd., of Richmond, Virginia. After nearly a year of distributing beer, an opportunity arose for Mike to work as a brewer for Legend Brewing Company. Mike worked with five other brewers to perform duties at all levels of production including brewing, cellar work, cleaning and maintenance.  After nearly four years of service at Legend Brewing Company, Mike moved to Boston, MA, so his wife, Kira, could attend grad school. Tired of listening to him whine about how much he missed brewing, Kira gave him a home brewing kit as an anniversary gift. Mike began brewing whenever he could find the time. He developed the recipes for Hammerin' Ale, Headbangerz Brown Ale, Square Feet Wheat, Weldspatter I.P.A. and several other beers in five-gallon batches on his apartment's balcony.  Mike was also commissioned by friends and co-workers to brew beer for special occasions.  In fact, Square Feet Wheat was actually first brewed for an art gallery opening featuring works by the Barbarian's logo and label designer, Erick Thomas.  After reading Brewing Up a Business: Adventures in Entrepreneurship by Sam Calagione of Dogfish Head Brewery fame, Mike was inspired to start his own brewery. He spent eight months researching and writing a business plan. Another year was spent gathering support and revising his business plans. Thanks to the support of family, friends and other area businessmen who believed in Mike's dream, Bavarian Barbarian Brewing Company is now a reality.

data.name: Happy Amber
data.description: This dry-hopped ale contains caramel and biscuit malt flavors in happy equilibrium with late addition American hops. The approachable balance is intentional although the name is a "hoppy" accident.

style.name: American-Style Amber/Red Ale
style.description: American amber/red ales range from light copper to light brown in color. They are characterized by American-variety hops used to produce the perception of medium hop bitterness, flavor, and medium aroma. Amber ales have medium-high to high maltiness with medium to low caramel character. They should have medium to medium-high body. The style may have low levels of fruityester flavor and aroma. Diacetyl can be either absent or barely perceived at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. Slight yeast haze is acceptable for bottle-conditioned products.

breweries.name: MadTree Brewing Company
breweries.description:
MadTree Brewing Company was started by three self-proclaimed “maniac” homebrewers and aspiring entrepreneurs who believe strongly in the creation of beers that stand up to the best craft brews across the country.
Along with that vision they put their own “mad twists” on their creations. The MadTree approach is simple – create high quality beer, educate the consumer, run a responsible business, and support the local communities.
MadTree engages local artists and craftspeople for their marketing materials, can designs, tap handles and furniture. Many of these efforts have received local and national recognition.

HIGHLIGHTS
- The trio quit their corporate jobs in 2012/2013 and in January 2013 they brewed their first commercial batch.
- In April they opened their taproom and became the first modern craft brewery to can their beer in the state of Ohio.
- Draft Magazine rated PsycHOPathy IPA a 97/100, the second best score for an IPA reviewed by Draft Magazine.
- PsycHOPathy IPA was named as one of the “Six New Craft Can Designs That Belong in an Art Gallery” by craftcans.com

data.name: Happy New Beer
data.description: Hi-Wire and Asheville Brewing teamed up to brew a beer to ring in the New Year. “Happy New Beer” is a Honey Red Ale made with Riverbend malt, over 50 lbs. of orange blossom honey and a unique malt from Canada that tastes like, you guessed it, honey. With an ABV of 7.6%, Happy New Beer is a malty and aromatic brew hopped with French Aramis hops which impart floral notes that meld deliciously with all the tasty malt and honey. Start 2015 off with a brew worth celebrating!

style.name: American-Style Amber/Red Ale
style.description: American amber/red ales range from light copper to light brown in color. They are characterized by American-variety hops used to produce the perception of medium hop bitterness, flavor, and medium aroma. Amber ales have medium-high to high maltiness with medium to low caramel character. They should have medium to medium-high body. The style may have low levels of fruityester flavor and aroma. Diacetyl can be either absent or barely perceived at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. Slight yeast haze is acceptable for bottle-conditioned products.

breweries.name: Hi-Wire Brewing
breweries.description:
At Hi-Wire, we really want to embrace our craft and be as independent and authentic as possible, while also managing to maintain an approachability to our product, as we feature highly drinkable, hand-crafted brews.

We’re fortunate to be able to be a part of one of the Craft Capitals of the country. Located in Asheville's "Brewery District", Hi-Wire's brewery and tasting room are within walking distance of six other local breweries in a few block radius. Come visit us in June, 2013.

breweries.name: The Livery
breweries.description: Over one hundred years ago, the building known as the Palace Livery provided a vital service making it a unique gathering place for residents of and travelers to Southwest Michigan. This former horse stable has been brought back to life as The Livery. Located at 190 5th street, in the Arts District of downtown Benton Harbor, Michigan, the Livery features 12 taps of "Hand-Forged Microbrew", 2 Real Ale taps, an outdoor bier garden, free WIFI, and a Café serving great food. Music and other live entertainment are regularly featured in The Upper Livery entertainment venue. You must be age 21 or older to enter The Livery. People under age 21 must be accompanied by parent or legal guardian.

breweries.name: Le Brewery
breweries.description:
Le Brewery is a family run business, founded by Steve Skews in 2001. We share a passion for beer which is crafted by hand using only the finest ingredients without any nasties in sight.

France is not a country noted for its beers, however, we've been on a mission to introduce good beer to Normandy. Le Brewery is located in the heart of cider country and produces British style real ale for the French market.

Our beer is brewed on a 10-barrel brew plant, with all natural top quality ingredients and live yeast for a superior taste. We produce a number of ‘house’ beers from the hoppy Norman Gold to our rich English milk stout, Odo.

breweries.name: BearWaters Brewing Company
breweries.description: BearWaters Brewing Company is located in Waynesville North Carolina in the beautiful Smoky Mountains of Western North Carolina. BearWaters was named in honor of the region's pristine source of mountain water. BearWaters captures the spirit, traditions and majesty of the Great Smoky Mountains. Come enjoy what happens when fearless creativity, maticulous brewing meets natures greatest natural resource.

data.name: Harvest Ale
data.description: Brewed each August to celebrate the hop harvest, our Harvest ale is a robust deep amber ale brewed with crystal, special B, & rye. Hopped with 6 different varieties, creating aroma & flavors reminiscent of fresh peaches.

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

style.name: American-Style Amber/Red Ale
style.description: American amber/red ales range from light copper to light brown in color. They are characterized by American-variety hops used to produce the perception of medium hop bitterness, flavor, and medium aroma. Amber ales have medium-high to high maltiness with medium to low caramel character. They should have medium to medium-high body. The style may have low levels of fruityester flavor and aroma. Diacetyl can be either absent or barely perceived at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. Slight yeast haze is acceptable for bottle-conditioned products.

breweries.name: Hales Ales Brewery and Pub
breweries.description:
Founded by Mike Hale in 1983, Hale's Ales is the Northwest's 3rd oldest and longest running independently owned brewery in the Northwest. Hale's built its long standing reputation by brewing small batch, full flavored ales using traditional English brewing methods.

An innovator from the start, Hale's was the first craft brewery to introduce Seasonal, Cask Conditioned and Nitrogen Conditioned ales to the region. Hale's goal is to stay true to what the craft brewing "revolution" is all about: crafting fresh, locally brewed ales of the very finest quality. Cheers from Hale's Ales!

data.name: Harvest Ale
data.description: Autumn – season of color and of transition from light to dark. Rust colored with a noble hop presence, our Harvest Ale is brewed in the Oakshire Tradition – thoughtfully crafted, original and delicious.

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

breweries.name: Oakshire Brewing Company
breweries.description: The name Oakshire represents Strength, Independence, Community, values held by our owners and employees.   Begun in October 2006 by brothers Jeff and Chris Althouse, Oakshire Brewing operates as a production brewery in the Bethel neighborhood in Northwest Eugene.    We make three year round beers, available in 22oz bottles and 12 oz cans and on draft found throughout Oregon, Washington, Idaho, and Alaska.  Oakshire makes a rotating seasonal beer available in 22oz bottles and on draft as well.  And the brewers at Oakshire craft a range of beers in their Single Batch Beers Series only available on draft.

data.name: Harvest Ale
data.description:
Our Harvest Ale is a labor of love. We used a blend of hops locally grown by our friend Bert, and spent many hours picking each hop cone by hand off the vines. The result is a light bodied, sessionable beer that features as much of that home grown hop goodness as possible.

Only 24 bottles were released in 2010.

breweries.name: White Birch Brewing
breweries.description: Founded in 2009, White Birch Brewing has been consistently dedicated to the creation of thoughtful, heartfelt ales for the fun loving beer drinker. Providing beers that range from historical, to contemporary, to the avant-garde, each batch of beer is carefully brewed by hand, and left unfiltered for an exceptional depth of flavor.

breweries.name: Levante Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Levante started as many home brewing dreams start; the mission to create the perfect beer in a three gallon pot in the kitchen of a small apartment. Eric and Tim quickly realized that this is an excercise in futility, but along the way, their steadfast persistence and the quest to make a truly satisfying beer has resulted in countless hours of research and experimentation. While the small 5 gallon batches allowed for plenty of great experience, they yearned for more creative control.

The brewers decided it was time for a more professional three vessel system, giving them complete control over the brewing process. The 1/2 barrel system gave the brewers a solid platform to refine and perfect a lineup of beers for the most discerning pallet. This led to the creation of several great recipes, and a roster of clean crisp beers. The original hobby transformed into a passion for sharing world-class hand crafted beers with those who would appreciate them. 

Levante Brewing currently brews on our 15 bbl production brewery system located in West Chester, PA. We are servicing several local restaurants, pubs and distributers. Levante aims to deliver a variety of creative brews to beer lovers in Philadelphia's western suburbs and beyond.

breweries.name: Bemidji Brewing Company
breweries.description: Bemidji Brewing Company LLC is a small craft brewery based out of the beautiful city of Bemidji, MN. Craft beer is our passion, and we hope to provide the freshest, most high quality craft beer to Bemidji and the northwoods.

data.name: Hava Copper Ale
data.description: Deep Copper tones and a decidedly smooth hop bite make this a highly enjoyable beer.

data.name: Haymaker
data.description:
This deep copper ale is unfiltered, full flavored and robust.  An extended boil generated intense caramel notes, offset by an assertive hop bitterness.  Raisin and dried cherry notes blend with shades of mild tropical fruit lead to a biscuit-like, slightly bitter finish.

Available in 1/2 barrel keg & 1/6 barrel keg.

breweries.name: Wineglass Bay Brewing
breweries.description: Craft brewing has been a passionate sideline for Freycinet winemaker Claudio Radenti and partner Lindy Bull for more than a decade. Hazards Ale was originally brewed at the St Ives brew-pub in Hobart; currently it’s being produced by Australian Independent Breweries in Sydney using Tasmanian grown malted barley and hops. The beer’s spiritual home is undoubtedly the Hazards Bar at Freycinet Lodge where you can enjoy this fruity, amber ale while gazing at the pink-tinged Hazards rock formation opposite.
